DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether pain IV catheter insertion Emergency Department reduce significantly use rapid act topical anesthetic spray determine whether healthcare provider undergo treatment likely endorse use future practice .
DOC.brief_title: Skin Refrigerant Reduce Pain Associated With IV Insertion
DOC.detailed_description: We recruit 38 emergency department healthcare provider ( doctor , physician assistant , nurse medic ) receive total two separate IV canulation - one one arm . One IV canulation would pretreated Ethyl Chloride topical anesthetic ( study product ) would pre-treated placebo ( sterile water aerosol ) . Both participant nurse , PAs medic place IVs blind Ethyl Chloride placebo . After IVs place participant ask rate pain IV canulation scale 1 10 pre-treatments , state one believe superior reduce pain receive IV , state whether would like intervention rat superior use finally likely 5 point scale incorporate intervention rat superior future practice .
DOC.criteria: 1 . At least 18 year age 2 . A healthcare worker routinely order place IV catheter . 3 . Consents participate study . 1 . History hypersensitivity Ethyl Chloride . 2 . Break , swollen skin propose IV site . 3 . Pregnancy lactate female . 4 . Recent tattoo either two propose anatomical area IV cannulation . 5 . Skin infection either two propose anatomical area IV cannulation . 6 . Missing contralateral limb place second IV . 7 . Recent trauma one upper extremity neuropathic radicular condition could affect participant 's perception pain antecubital fossa arm .
